member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgen.InitiateGeneration
member.summary: If the function generator is in the Configuration State, this method moves the function generator to the Output Generation State. If the function generator is already in the Output Generation State, this method does nothing and returns Success.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgen.AbortGeneration
member.summary: If the function generator is in the Output Generation State, this method moves the function generator to the Configuration State. If the function generator is already in the Configuration State, the method does nothing and returns Success.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenAM.GetEnabled(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the enabled/disabled state of the function generator amplitude modulation. If enabled, the function generator applies amplitude modulation to the signal that the function generator produces.
member.param: A string that uniquely identifies a channel. It may be defined by the driver or supplied as a virtual name in the configuration store. For single output instruments, the driver may define the empty string as a valid channel name.
member.returns: If true, the function generator applies amplitude modulation to the signal that the function generator produces.

If true, the function generator applies amplitude modulation to the signal that the function generator produces.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenAM.GetSource(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the source of the signal that the function generator uses as the modulating waveform. Applies only when the GetEnabled method returns True.
member.param: A string that uniquely identifies a channel. It may be defined by the driver or supplied as a virtual name in the configuration store. For single output instruments, the driver may define the empty string as a valid channel name.
member.returns: The source of the signal that the function generator uses as the modulating waveform.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenAM.SetSource(System.String,Ivi.Fgen.AMSource)

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenAM.InternalDepth
member.summary: The extent of modulation the function generator applies to the carrier waveform when the GetSource method returns AMSource.Internal. The unit is percentage. Applies only when the GetSource method returns AMSource.Internal.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenAM.InternalFrequency
member.summary: The frequency of the internal modulating waveform source. The units are Hertz. Applies only when the GetSource method returns AMSource.Internal.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenAM.InternalWaveformFunction
member.summary: The standard waveform of the internal modulating waveform source. Applies only when the GetSource method returns AMSource.Internal.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrary.BinaryAlignment
member.summary: Identifies whether the arbitrary waveform generator treats binary data provided to the IIviFgenArbitraryWaveform methods as left-justified or right-justified. This is only relevant if the generator supports bit-depths less than 16, or less than 32 if the generator supports bit-depths greater than 16. For a 16-bit or a 32-bit generator, this method can return either value.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrary.SampleBitResolution
member.summary: The number of significant bits that the generator supports in an arbitrary waveform. Together with the binary alignment, this allows the user to know the range and resolution of the integers in the waveform.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrary.DataMask
member.summary: A mask that determines what bits of the output data are masked out. This is especially useful when combined with Data Markers so that the bits embedded with the data to be used for markers are not actually output by the generator.

member.summary: IVI Fgen class-compliant arbitrary sequence interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.Configure(System.String,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures channel, waveform handle, gain, and offset for arbitrary sequence generation.
member.param: A string that uniquely identifies a channel. It may be defined by the driver or supplied as a virtual name in the configuration store. For single output instruments, the driver may define the empty string as a valid channel name.
Specifies the handle that identifies the arbitrary sequence to produce.
Specifies the arbitrary waveform gain. Refer to the IIviFgenArbitrary.GetGain and IIviFgenArbitrary.SetGain methods for details.
Specifies the arbitrary waveform offset. Refer to the IIviFgenArbitrary.GetOffset and IIviFgenArbitrary.SetOffset methods for details.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.Clear(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a previously created arbitrary sequence from the function generator's memory and invalidates the sequence's handle.
member.param: Specifies the handle that identifies the arbitrary sequence to clear.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.Create(System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Creates an arbitrary waveform sequence from an array of waveform handles and a corresponding array of loop counts, and returns a handle that identifies the sequence. The handle is used by the Configure, and Clear methods.
member.param: Specifies the array of waveform handles for the new arbitrary sequence. Each WfmHandle array element has a corresponding LoopCount array element that specifies how many times that waveform is repeated.

Specifies the array of loop counts for the new arbitrary sequence. Each LoopCount array element corresponds to a WfmHandle array element and indicates how many times to repeat that waveform. Each element of the LoopCount array must be less than or equal to the maximum number of loop counts the function generator allows. To determine the function generator's maximum loop count, use the LoopCountMax property.
member.returns: Returns the handle that identifies the new arbitrary sequence.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.DepthMax
member.summary: The maximum sequence depth - that is, the number of times a sequence can include other sequences recursively. A depth of zero indicates the generator supports waveforms only. A depth of 1 indicates a generator supports sequences of waveforms, but not sequences of sequences. A depth of 2 or greater indicates that the generator supports sequences of sequences.
member.remarks: Note that if the MaxSequenceDepth is 2 or greater, the driver must return unique handles for waveforms and sequences so that a sequence may contain both waveform and sequence handles.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.LengthMax
member.summary: The maximum number of arbitrary waveforms that the function generator allows in an arbitrary sequence.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.LengthMin
member.summary: The minimum number of arbitrary waveforms that the function generator allows in an arbitrary sequence.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.LoopCountMax
member.summary: The maximum number of times that the function generator can repeat a waveform in a sequence.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.NumberSequencesMax
member.summary: The maximum number of arbitrary sequences that the function generator allows.

member.summary: Creates a channel-specific waveform and returns a handle to it. The handle is used by the Configure, Clear, and IIviFgenArbitrarySequence.Create methods.
member.param: A string that uniquely identifies a channel. It may be defined by the driver or supplied as a virtual name in the configuration store. For single output instruments, the driver may define the empty string as a valid channel name.

A waveform object that implements IWaveform to use for the new arbitrary waveform. The waveform array must have at least as many elements as the value in the Size parameter. The array's elements, after being scaled, must be normalized between -1.00 and +1.00.

member.name: P:Ivi.Fgen.IIviFgenOutput.ReferenceClockSource

Specifies the waveform frequency. Refer to the GetFrequency and SetFrequency methods for details.
Specifies the waveform start phase. Refer to the GetStartPhase and GetStartPhase methods for details.

member.name: T:Ivi.Fgen.IviFgen
member.summary: The IviFgen class allows clients to create instances of drivers that implement the class-compliant IviFgen interfaces, based on information in the IVI configuration store. This allows clients to interchange IVI.NET class-compliant IviFgen drivers without modifying or rebuilding the client program source code.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IviFgen.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviFgen class-compliant driver and return an IIviFgen reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery and reset parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviFgen driver to be created.
member.returns: An IIviFgen interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IviFgen.Create(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviFgen class-compliant driver and return an IIviFgen reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery and reset parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviFgen driver to be created.
If true, verify the ID of the instrument.
If true, reset the instrument.
member.returns: An IIviFgen interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IviFgen.Create(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviFgen class-compliant driver and return an IIviFgen reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery, reset, and options parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviFgen driver to be created.
If true, verify the ID of the instrument.
If true, reset the instrument.

A comma-separated list of option assignments. An options assignment has the form "OptionName=Value", where OptionName is one of: 'Cache', 'InterchangeCheck', 'QueryInstrStatus', 'RangeCheck', 'RecordCoercions', 'Simulate', or 'DriverSetup'. With the exception of DriverSetup, all of the options accept values of 'true' or 'false'. 'DriverSetup' is a string, and must be last in the list. The method assumes that everything following 'DriverSetup=' is part of the assignment. The DriverSetup string is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.
member.returns: An IIviFgen interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.
member.remarks:
Examples of legal values for the options parameter are:
* ""
* "Simulate=true"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,QueryInstrStatus=false"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,DriverSetup=Trace=false"
Note that 'Simulate', 'Cache', and 'QueryInstrStatus' are standard IVI features, while 'Trace=false' is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.

member.name: M:Ivi.Fgen.IviFgen.Create(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Ivi.Driver.LockType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviFgen class-compliant driver and return an IIviFgen reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery, reset, and options parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviFgen driver to be created.
If true, verify the ID of the instrument.
If true, reset the instrument.
Specifies whether to use .NET AppDomain-wide locking or machine-wide locking.

Specifies a user-selectable access key to identify the lock. Driver instances that are created with the same accessKey will be protected from simultaneous access by multiple threads within a process or across processes, depending upon the value of the lockType parameter.

A comma-separated list of option assignments. An options assignment has the form "OptionName=Value", where OptionName is one of: 'Cache', 'InterchangeCheck', 'QueryInstrStatus', 'RangeCheck', 'RecordCoercions', 'Simulate', or 'DriverSetup'. With the exception of DriverSetup, all of the options accept values of 'true' or 'false'. 'DriverSetup' is a string, and must be last in the list. The method assumes that everything following 'DriverSetup=' is part of the assignment. The DriverSetup string is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.
member.returns: An IIviFgen interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.
member.remarks:
Examples of legal values for the options parameter are:
* ""
* "Simulate=true"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,QueryInstrStatus=false"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,DriverSetup=Trace=false"
Note that 'Simulate', 'Cache', and 'QueryInstrStatus' are standard IVI features, while 'Trace=false' is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.
